chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan Joseph Lee Stowers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Threat to Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.
Absolute sobriety. No alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Mental health evaluation and any treatment deemed necessary.

records.addlTxt: 10:18 AM Defendant Jordan Joseph Lee Stowers appeared by video, in custody at the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson in court for Jordan Joseph Lee Stowers.  Attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1; Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 are dismissed and read in.  Defendant waives right to presentence investigation. Court orders sentence withheld, 2 years probation, any treatment deemed necessary, AODA, mental health assessment and any treatment needed, absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, costs due to Clerk of Court, 100 days sentence credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Activity:  Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:16 AM Defendant Jordan Joseph Lee Stowers in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video.  Richard Jay Sullivan and intern Verity Altenberger appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Defense argues for bond modification. Court denies motion.

3:46 PM Defendant Jordan Joseph Lee Stowers in court by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video. Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond set of $500.00 with conditions: No intentional contact with Officer J.D. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Maintain absolute sobriety. No possession of any paraphernalia. Curfew from 6pm-6am unless at work or traveling to and from work. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom and scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 9:15 AM.
